meanings.definition: A person who has the right to vote in an election.
meanings.sent1: The elector cast his vote in the election.
meanings.sent2: The elector went to the polling station to vote.
meanings.sent3: The elector carefully chose the candidate he believed in.
meanings.sent4: She was the elector who decided the outcome of the election.
meanings.sent5: As an elector, he held the power to influence the election results.

meanings.definition: A member of the electoral college.
meanings.sent1: The elector represented his state in the electoral college.
meanings.sent2: Being an elector in the college was a great responsibility.
meanings.sent3: The elector in the college had a key role in the election process.
meanings.sent4: She was the elector who tipped the scales in the electoral college.
meanings.sent5: As an elector, he participated in the important decision-making of the college.

meanings.definition: A person who chooses or elects someone to a position or office.
meanings.sent1: The elector selected the new leader for the organization.
meanings.sent2: Being an elector meant having the power to appoint officials.
meanings.sent3: The elector had the task of picking the best candidate for the job.
meanings.sent4: She was the elector who handpicked the CEO of the company.
meanings.sent5: As an elector, he had the responsibility of nominating the right person for the role.
